t: 1 Chronicles 16
The Ark Placed in the Tabernacle
So*p they brought the ark of God, and set it in the midst of the tabernacle that David had erected for it. Then they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.
And when David had finished offering the burnt offerings and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord.*s
Then he distributed to everyone of Israel, both man and woman, to everyone a loaf of bread, a piece of*i meat,*i and a cake of raisins.
And*p he appointed some of the Levites to minister before the ark of the Lord,*s to commemorate, to thank, and to praise the Lord*s God of Israel:
Asaph the chief, and next to him Zechariah, then*i Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, and Obed-Edom: Jeiel with stringed instruments and harps, but Asaph made music with cymbals;
Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests regularly blew*i the trumpets before the ark of the covenant of God.
David’s Song of Thanksgiving
On*p that day David first delivered this*i psalm*i into the hand of Asaph and his brethren, to thank the Lord:*s
Oh,*pn give thanks to the Lord!*s Call*ld upon His name; Make*ld known His deeds among the peoples!
Sing*ld to Him, sing psalms to Him; Talk*ld of all His wondrous works!
Glory*ld in His holy name; Let*ld the hearts of those rejoice who seek the Lord!*s
Seek*ld the Lord*s and His strength; Seek*ld His face evermore!
Remember*ld His marvelous works which He has done, His*ld wonders, and the judgments of His mouth,
O*ld seed of Israel His servant, You*ld children of Jacob, His chosen ones!
He*ln is*i the Lord*s our God; His*ld judgments are*i in all the earth.
Remember*ld His covenant forever, The*ld word which He commanded, for a thousand generations,
The*ild covenant which He made with Abraham, And*ld His oath to Isaac,
And*ld confirmed it to Jacob for a statute, To*ld Israel for*i an everlasting covenant,
Saying,*ld “To you I will give the land of Canaan As*ld the allotment of your inheritance,”
When*ld you were few in number, Indeed*ld very few, and strangers in it.
When*ln they went from one nation to another, And*ld from one*i kingdom to another people,
He*ld permitted no man to do them wrong; Yes,*ld He rebuked kings for their sakes,
Saying,*ild “Do not touch My anointed ones, And*ld do My prophets no harm.”
Sing*ln to the Lord,*s all the earth; Proclaim*ld the good news of His salvation from day to day.
Declare*ld His glory among the nations, His*ld wonders among all peoples.
For*ln the Lord*s is*i great and greatly to be praised; He*ld is*i also to be feared above all gods.
For*ld all the gods of the peoples are*i idols, But*ld the Lord*s made the heavens.
Honor*ld and majesty are*i before Him; Strength*ld and gladness are in His place.
Give*ln to the Lord,*s O families of the peoples, Give*ld to the Lord*s glory and strength.
Give*ld to the Lord*s the glory due*i His name; Bring*ld an offering, and come before Him. Oh,*ld worship the Lord*s in the beauty of holiness!
Tremble*ld before Him, all the earth. The*ld world also is firmly established, It*ld shall not be moved.
Let*ln the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; And*ld let them say among the nations, “The Lord*s reigns.”
Let*ld the sea roar, and all its fullness; Let*ld the field rejoice, and all that is*i in it.
Then*ld the trees of the woods shall rejoice before the Lord,*s For*ld He is coming to judge the earth.
Oh,*ln give thanks to the Lord,*s for He*i is*i good! For*ld His mercy endures*i forever.
And*ld say, “Save us, O God of our salvation; Gather*ld us together, and deliver us from the Gentiles, To*ld give thanks to Your holy name, To*ld triumph in Your praise.”
Blessed*ln be*i the Lord*s God of Israel From*ld everlasting to everlasting! And*p all the people said, “Amen!” and praised the Lord.*s
Regular Worship Maintained
So*p he left Asaph and his brothers there before the ark of the covenant of the Lord*s to minister before the ark regularly, as every day’s work required;
and Obed-Edom with his sixty-eight brethren, including Obed-Edom the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah, to*i be*i gatekeepers;
and Zadok the priest and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of the Lord*s at the high place that was*i at Gibeon,
to offer burnt offerings to the Lord*s on the altar of burnt offering regularly morning and evening, and to*i do*i according to all that is written in the Law of the Lord*s which He commanded Israel;
and with them Heman and Jeduthun and the rest who were chosen, who were designated by name, to give thanks to the Lord,*s because His mercy endures*i forever;
and with them Heman and Jeduthun, to sound aloud with trumpets and cymbals and the musical instruments of God. Now the sons of Jeduthun were*i gatekeepers.
Then*p all the people departed, every man to his house; and David returned to bless his house.
